body_html:
Indeed they are not the same, and I think it should be t.op instead of consumer ops.
Consider how it works now

import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.graph_editor as ge

A0 = tf.ones((), name='A0')
A1 = tf.tanh(A0, name='A1')
print(ge.get_forward_walk_ops(A0))     # => [A1]
print(ge.get_forward_walk_ops(A0.op))  # => [A0, A1]

Consider how it works now
import tensorflow as tf

body:
Indeed they are not the same, and I think it should be `t.op` instead of consumer ops.
Consider how it works now

```
import tensorflow as tf
import tensorflow.contrib.graph_editor as ge

A0 = tf.ones((), name='A0')
A1 = tf.tanh(A0, name='A1')
print(ge.get_forward_walk_ops(A0))     # => [A1]
print(ge.get_forward_walk_ops(A0.op))  # => [A0, A1]

```
